General course objectives:
General course objectives
The course will enable the students to understand the interplay between products/services and the market based on Design Thinking principles and develop the students’ skills for entrepreneurial marketing, following a customer development process.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Design a viable business solutions for a particular product/service, using Design Thinking principles
List the various conceptualizations of the market and describe the qualification of a product on the market
Understand the interplay among value, behavioral change and business model
Understand and follow customer development process (customer discovery, customer validation, customer creation and customer building)
Analyze how organizations use the marketing mix to market products/services to their target customers
Explain fundamental concepts of business strategy
Explain and use fundamental concepts of branding and advertising techniques
Apply strategic pricing to a product/service
Conduct market analysis for a particular product/service
Understand and apply digital marketing tools to a particular product/service
Analyse the relation between a product and its market using the theoretical perspectives of the course curriculum
Content: The students will be asked to develop a marketing planning with respect to a specific product/service, following a customer development process. The course will enable the students to think strategically about developing customers through various approaches in entrepreneurial marketing. The course is based on a combination of empirical examples, theories and concepts about market, business design, strategy and marketing.
